item.description:
Public screening of "Fields of Fuel" aka "Fuel"

"The film tells the story of biodiesel, an alternative fuel for diesel engines. Made from vegetable oil, it is non-toxic, has low carbon dioxide emissions and can ultimately replace all liquid fuels used in the United States, thus freeing America's dependence on oil needed for gasoline." -from IMDB

"With America so dependent on oil, filmmaker Joshua Tickell sets out to prove that biodiesel, made from vegetable oil, is a viable alternative. Although politicians and energy execs have done their best to quell it, the benefits of biodiesel are real. This documentary chronicles Tickell's quest to popularize the untraditional fuel source, citing the environmental and economic advantages the country could reap by adopting it." - from Netflix
item.how_to_find_us: Park in the lot. Through the double doors, hang a right.
item.name: GWH MEETING - January 2009- "Fields of Fuel" aka "Fuel"
